intro: Dryandra fuscobractea, commonly known as the black bract dryandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, needle-like leaves and showy, pinkish-red floral displays. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Its habitat typically includes sandy soils in open woodlands and heathlands. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
